title: Clustering of Visual Data using Ant-inspired Methods

presenter: Tijana Janjusevic, Department of Electronic Engineering, Queen Mary, University of London

segmentation: Hello everyone, my name is Steven and you shoot.
I'm presenting the work of my colleague.
Thomas, Patrick and I, I wasn't involved in his work, but I will try my best to explain what is his research about.
First, I will give a brief introduction about clustering and classification.
Then I will point out some.
Famous bilogical inspired optimization system.
Then I will say something about Thomas is work, which is actually two implementations of biologically inspired optimization system.
One is ACO based image classifier and the second one is entry for Windows summarization.
Classification is part of data mining tasks and.
Task is to sign images according to semantic content to predefined classes.
The performance of the image classification algorithms depends on the efficient optimization techniques.
Boo.

Logically, inspired optimization techniques are recently inspiration for as methods for solving the optimization tasks in a classic image classification and most famous 1 ones are artificial immune systems.
Particles form an uncolonized systems.
Domish in his work applied on colony optimization system, which is metaheuristic approach that uses strategies of ants to solve optimization problems.
He's trying to model the way the ants are finding the shortest path following pheromones of the other.
Once on cooling system was first proposed as a method for solving the traveling salesman problem of how to find the shortest path between two nodes.
If you have a set of nodes and distances between them.
So in this method.
Probability of choosing the next node depends on paramount value and on heuristic information.
If you more if you require more information about this approach, I have to refer you to Thomas and give you his email in the end of the presentation.
Basically, his idea is to if he has a set of images to cluster the images.
But that each cluster of images has different features which are important for that set.
Oh sorry.
So for example, this is an example from a coral database, and for images of lion.
Code structure and code layout are the important features and for example, for clouds it was called structure and text textual feature.
His approach is basically subspace clustering using ACO, where he.
He's he's using this approach to find the optimal set of features for each set of images, so each and clusters images according to different local feature rates and Fairmont value from previous.
Solution this is the proposed algorithm in four steps.
Basically, first he performs initial clustering.
Then he computes weights and centuries of the cluster.
He performs a pheromone update and then next iteration follows according to the.
Same algorithm.
I will present three experimental evaluation.

First one was performed on synthetic data in the first table you can see that different groups have different weights for different features, and in the second table Thomases approach, which is the first one, is compared to three other approach, which is which are pro class GFS K means and K means an.
According to these results, he his method performs better than the other ones.
The second experimental set was a coral image database where he had 600 images.
With Six 6 semantic concepts, as you can see here, and again he compared his results with three others.
The table represents average error rate and this means that, for example, for his approach, since the error rate is 0.30 means that 70% of images were clustered correctly.
The third experimental set was Flickr image database where he had 500 images segmented.
In two regions, the table shows the results again comparing to three other methods where he has had five concepts and extended set of 10 concepts and again his results are very good comparing 2.
The other ones.
The the second biologically inspired.
System is on 3 for video summarization.
This is the second part of Thomas Research.
Basically he he uses, he tries to model the behavior of African Ant colony to obtain the summarization of video.
General principle is that each hand represents node of the tree, and it also represents A-frame in video and each frame tries to find the most similar one.
Visualize and temporal eyes.
So here.
As you can see, there are five clusters.
Each cluster is represented by a support frame.
One video can have several branches, and each branch can have sub branches.
But for summary of the whole video, only first branch is taken for each from each sub.
Three to determine the length of video segment.
The maximum number of negative cluster frame going consecutively is using used as a threshold, and each segment has maximum length of 10 seconds.
I will show you a small demo.
So as you can see here, he his method identified 6.
Segments.
And from 4 1/2 minutes of surveillance video he obtained the video summary of 53 seconds.
Ends here you can see.
Different.
Segments of video.
And this is the summary.
Basically, these are the future work.
He intends to try to apply firm driven mechanism for optimization of clustering ties task by searching for a number of clusters that list the best clustering.
Because at this moment the number of cluster has to be set manually at the beginning and he also wants to implement the feature selection for video summarization and see detection.
I tried to present his work as best as I could, but if you have some detail question.
The best thing is to.
Contact Thomas and he's here is his email.
Thank you.
